name: Deploy a Clodo service to Cloudflare Workers
description: Quick hands-on steps to scaffold, test, and deploy a Clodo service to Cloudflare Workers and measure latency improvements at the edge.

steps.name: Install Clodo Framework
steps.text: Install Clodo Framework in your development environment: `npm install @tamyla/clodo-framework` or use the global installer as needed.

steps.name: Scaffold a Clodo service
steps.text: Run `npx create-clodo-service my-edge-service --type data-service` to generate a starter service scaffold with templates tuned for Cloudflare Workers.

steps.name: Configure for Workers & D1
steps.text: Enable the Cloudflare Workers target and configure D1 and environment variables. Update routing and bindings in `wrangler.toml` or Clodo deploy configuration.

steps.name: Test locally and benchmark
steps.text: Run the service locally (e.g., `wrangler dev` or `clodo dev`) and measure latency vs a cloud-hosted variant to validate edge gains.

steps.name: Deploy & monitor
steps.text: Deploy to Cloudflare, verify edge responses, and monitor metrics. Use progressive rollout and synthetic latency tests in production.
